intro: Chaetogastra crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf chaetogastra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive, rough texture. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
